TopicTitle: 174.9 m/s..... sitting still on the launch pad

Articles.Content:
Like the title says, my vessel is sitting still on the launch pad, yet it reports that it is moving at 175m/s. 

I'm using hyperedit to mess around and launch a large station built with B9 parts, but when I set the orbit, the entire ship flings apart, and I think it could be due in part to the reported velocity.
Check whether your navball is in orbital or surface mode. You can click on the velocity indicator to switch between Surface, Orbital, and Target relative velocity modes.
Did that. Orbit was 0 and Surface was 175.

That's different...

Could you post a copy of your output\_log.txt after causing the problem? If you're not sure where to find it, see the [thread=92229]How to Get Support[/thread] sticky. The other information requested there may help, too.

... How many mods is that? I see well over 100 plugins alone.

I have one suggestion: try copying and pasting (not moving) the entire KSP folder to a new location like C:\Games\ that has normal permissions. If that works, you can try to fix the permissions in the current location.

Otherwise, I'm afraid you'll have to narrow it down by removing mods until you can reproduce the problem with just one or two. There are simply too many exceptions to get a clear picture of what's going wrong.

Ok. I'll try that. 

And yeah, I may have gone a bit crazy when I found ckan.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067-The-Comprehensive-Kerbal-Archive-Network-%28CKAN%29-Package-Manager-v1-6-0-9-Feb-2015](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067-The-Comprehensive-Kerbal-Archive-Network-%28CKAN%29-Package-Manager-v1-6-0-9-Feb-2015)
I figured out why my ships were flinging apart at least. When KJR would stabilize the physics load, things got wonky. Removed it and it's working well.
